EmoteActions.Message: Hail, adventurer! Queen Elysa recently appointed me to lead the garrison here in Yaraq. She was deeply grieved when the 12 Training Halls were destroyed and wants to ensure that no harm will come to her subjects here.

To that end, I have a small task for you: We have heard that a newcomer to this town has moved into a villa that has lain abandoned for many years. No one knows where he came from, although it is said he speaks with a Northern accent. Would you stop by his residence, and find out more about him? He lives to the southwest, near Lubziklan al-Luq's apple orchards.

Hail, adventurer! Queen Elysa recently appointed me to lead the garrison here in Yaraq. She was deeply grieved when the 12 Training Halls were destroyed and wants to ensure that no harm will come to her subjects here.

To that end, I have a small task for you: We have heard that a newcomer to this town has moved into a villa that has lain abandoned for many years. No one knows where he came from, although it is said he speaks with a Northern accent. Would you stop by his residence, and find out more about him? He lives to the southwest, near Lubziklan al-Luq's apple orchards.
Appalled, Dame Tsaya gingerly handles the human husk and covers it with a linen cloth.

You found this in the Darkened Halls? Poor soul. I can only wonder what he went through in his last tortures.  What dark intent could spur the Hollow Minions into committing such an atrocity? No wonder that stranger asked you so nicely to visit his comrades in those Halls--he must have been seeded here to send weak, innocent victims to their deaths--luckily he failed in taking your measure.  I must write Sir Rylanan immediately and alert him to the crimes being committed here.
Please take this letter to Sir Rylanan in Holtburg. He must know immediately of the terrible crimes that are being committed here in Yaraq.
I must now reward you for your discoveries here today.
Appalled, Dame Tsaya gingerly handles the human husk and covers it with a linen cloth.

You found this in the Darkened Halls? Poor soul. I can only wonder what he went through in his last tortures.  What dark intent could spur the Hollow Minions into committing such an atrocity? No wonder that stranger asked you so nicely to visit his comrades in those Halls--he must have been seeded here to send weak, innocent victims to their deaths--luckily he failed in taking your measure.  I must write Sir Rylanan immediately and alert him to the crimes being committed here.
Please take this letter to Sir Rylanan in Holtburg. He must know immediately of the terrible crimes that are being committed here in Yaraq.
But first, I must reward you for your discoveries here today.
Dame Tsaya quickly glances over the letter from her comrade in Shoushi.

What a disappointing happenstance. Not only has a farmer been allowed to stockpile an arsenal in his basement, but he is concealing stolen Guards uniforms as well? And Rylanan is having his own share of suspicious behavior up in Holtburg too...I wonder what trouble could be brewing now?

Nonetheless, perhaps you could aid me as well.  Queen Elysa recently appointed me to lead the garrison here in Yaraq. She was deeply grieved when the 12 Training Halls were destroyed and wants to ensure that no harm will come to her subjects here.

To that end, I have a small task for you: We have heard that a newcomer to this town has moved into a villa that has lain abandoned for many years. No one knows where he came from, although it is said he speaks with a Northern accent. Would you stop by his residence, and find out more about him? He lives to the east, past Lubziklan al-Luq's house.
You say you found this note near Holtburg? You should take it to Sir Rylanan. He is overseeing the garrision in Shoushi and will be interested in any local developments.
You say you found this note near Shoushi? You should take it to Sir Tenshin. He is overseeing the garrision in Shoushi and will be interested in any local developments.
What's this? Planting? Crops? Harvest? Old Man Witshire had a farm? This requires more thought. Here, you should keep this, I have already memorized it.
You say you found this object near Holtburg? You should take it to Sir Rylanan. He is overseeing the garrison in Holtburg and will be interested in any local developments.

You say you found this uniform in Shoushi? Most irregular--no one should have these uniforms on hand except the members of the Strathelar Guard themselves. You should take it to Sir Tenshin. He is overseeing the garrision in Shoushi and will be interested in any local developments.
This letter is addressed to Sir Tenshin. You should take it to him in Shoushi.
This letter is addressed to Sir Tenshin. You should take it to him in Shoushi.
Dame Tsaya quickly glances over the letter from her comrade in Shoushi.

What a disappointing happenstance. Not only has a farmer been allowed to stockpile an arsenal in his basement, but he is concealing stolen Guards uniforms as well? Tenshin must learn to keep better order than this.

Nonetheless, perhaps you could aid me as well.  Queen Elysa recently appointed me to lead the garrison here in Yaraq. She was deeply grieved when the 12 Training Halls were destroyed and wants to ensure that no harm will come to her subjects here.

To that end, I have a small task for you: We have heard that a newcomer to this town has moved into a villa that has lain abandoned for many years. No one knows where he came from, although it is said he speaks with a Northern accent. Would you stop by his residence, and find out more about him? He lives to the southwest, near Lubziklan al-Luq's apple orchards.
This letter is addressed to Sir Rylanan. You should take it to him in Holtburg.
This letter is addressed to Sir Rylanan. You should take it to him in Holtburg.
Dame Tsaya sighs deeply and shuts her eyes after reading the contents of the folded note.

I was right, in all except one thing. It was Borelean's life at stake, not Elysa's. And to attempt his murder through us, the Queen's own Guard...an audacious plan. Martine deserves no mercy for this, you have my word. We of the Strathelar Guard owe you a great debt for warding off what would have been a terrible tragedy--especially for Elysa and Asheron.
Dame Tsaya sighs deeply and shuts her eyes after reading the contents of the folded note.

I was right, in all except one thing. It was Borelean's life at stake, not Elysa's. And to attempt his murder through us, the Queen's own Guard...an audacious plan. Martine deserves no mercy for this, you have my word. We of the Strathelar Guard owe you a great debt for warding off what would have been a terrible tragedy--especially for Elysa and Asheron.

Martine deserves no mercy for this, you have my word. We of the Strathelar Guard owe you a great debt for warding off what would have been a terrible tragedy--especially for Elysa and Asheron.
Dame Tsaya sighs deeply and shuts her eyes after reading the contents of the folded note.

I was right, in all except one thing. It was Borelean's life at stake, not Elysa's. And to attempt his murder through us, the Queen's own Guard...an audacious plan. Martine deserves no mercy for this, you have my word. We of the Strathelar Guard owe you a great debt for warding off what would have been a terrible tragedy--especially for Elysa and Asheron.

You are still remembered well among the Guards. Such service to the crown does not go unnoticed, comrade. There have not been any new developments for me to relate, but come back in two weeks--I am sure we have not heard the last from Martine.
I see you have come back from the Fort in one piece. Do you have any more interesting finds for me?
No doubt Fort Witshire is exceedingly more difficult than has been in the past.

Thank you for your assistance in this matter, my friend. If you haven't already, you should take the letter I gave you to Sir Rylanan in Holtburg. What I learned today worries me a great deal. I fear for the people of this peaceful town, now I know what lies up in the hills of Yaraq...
Dame Tsaya turns to you gravely.
Yes, what did you discover up in the Darkened Halls?

The stranger actually asked you to visit his new "friend" down in the Darkened Halls? That dismal place has always been just the lair of some lowly Drudges, to my knowledge...perhaps you should investigate this matter. If you find anything out of the ordinary, I'd appreciate it if you brought it to me for inspection. Something just doesn't sound quite right.
I am mentoring Sir Tenshin in the responsibilities that come with being the leader of an important garrison. Did he send any letters for me along with you? I do like to keep track of his progress.

Greetings. I believe Sir Tenshin over in Shoushi has a matter in which he requires assistance. Please go to him and offer your help in whatever he requires. As his mentor, I would normally go myself, but I am afraid I must attend to my duties here.

Thank you for your assistance in this matter, my friend. If you haven't already, you should take the letter I gave you to Sir Rylanan in Holtburg. What I learned today worries me a great deal. I fear for the people of this peaceful town, now I know what lies up in the hills of Yaraq...
Dame Tsaya turns to you gravely.
Yes, what did you discover up in the Darkened Halls?

The stranger actually asked you to visit his new "friend" down in the Darkened Halls? That dismal place has always been just the lair of some lowly Drudges, to my knowledge...perhaps you should investigate this matter. If you find anything out of the ordinary, I'd appreciate it if you brought it to me for inspection. Something just doesn't sound quite right.
Appalled, Dame Tsaya gingerly handles the human husk and covers it with a linen cloth.

You found this in the Darkened Halls? Poor soul. I can only wonder what he went through in his last tortures.  What dark intent could spur the Hollow Minions into committing such an atrocity? No wonder that stranger asked you so nicely to visit his comrades in those Halls--he must have been seeded here to send weak, innocent victims to their deaths--luckily he failed in taking your measure.  I must write Sir Rylanan immediately and alert him to the crimes being committed here.
Please take this letter to Sir Rylanan in Holtburg. He must know immediately of the terrible crimes that are being committed here in Yaraq.
I must now reward you for your discoveries here today.
Dame Tsaya quickly glances over the letter from her comrade in Shoushi and muses aloud.

I have no doubt now that what has occurred here and in Holtburg and Shoushi are connected. Rylanan reports that the Hollow Minions are siphoning portal energy into concentrated spherules of glass. Tenshin tells me that a man has been discovered hoarding weapons and stolen Guard's uniforms. And the terrible atrocities here in Yaraq, under my own watch...
Dame Tsaya abruptly comes to a conclusion.

The Hollow Minions are creating their own Simulacra by somehow channeling portal space energy into these poor human husks. I have no doubt their plan was to clothe their Simulacra in our uniforms to infiltrate the Guard. Our Queen is in danger, and we must put a stop to this.
I have received reports that a band of Hollow Minions have barricaded themselves into Fort Witshire. I am now confident that the fort must house the headquarters of this plot.
Dame Tsaya sizes you up speculatively.

I believe I have just the plan. Fort Witshire was built upon the ruins of an old Empyrean prison. We can infiltrate the fort if we first go through its lower passageways. We created this portal to reach the prison, and I have only been waiting for the right person to grant permission to use it--and I now believe that person is you.

Press onwards to the top, and when you enter Fort Witshire itself, try to find out who is commanding the Hollow Minions there. This key may be of good use once you enter the fort--it was found among Witshire's effects when he left the fort. I cannot emphasize how much I believe the Queen's safety depends on this. Good luck.
